comment: Harvey Itano, MD, PhD, is the scientist who proved that the hemoglobin in sickle cell anemia was different from the hemoglobin in normal people, using a special kind of electrophoresis. This is the first time a disease had been proven to be caused by a molecular defect. Given that the professor named so many scientists during this lecture, it's strange that he left out Harvey Itano--especially since Itano graduated from the very university where this lecture is taking place--and as the Valedictorian, no less.
